title: Friendship
creator: Paramount+
review: Paul Rudd 'comedy' that does a fantastic job of making me feel quite uncomfortable through cringe - but honestly that's not how I want to spend 90 minutes so abandoned after 10.

title: Shell
creator: Paramount+
review: Paramount don't give much away in their listings, describing this as 'comedy' but really it wants to be horror comedy, not one of my preferred genres. Competent enough and builds a sense of menace very well but too gory for me, skipped the nasty bits!

title: Pole to Pole with Jane McDonald
creator: ITV
review: Completely undemanding but quite pleasant travelogue that stays just the right side of being an advertorial for the sponsoring cruise line - but only just!

title: Rip
creator: Amazon Prime
review: Initially confusing as everyone seems to be working against each other and never in their own best interests but by the end results in a satisfying story of uncovering bent Miami cops during a raid on a cartel stash house.

title: Kidnapped - Elizabeth Smart
creator: Netflix
review: Documentary of an extraordinary story of kidnap rape and abuse. Hard to watch at times, well constructed to keep up the tension. Astonishing that the kidnappers encampment was never found, the police and local community didnâ€™t do a great job there, but some facts (e.g. the actual distance to the camp) would have been useful.

title: Mr. Mercedes
creator: Netflix
review: It's OK to be slow moving and moody if the premise is interesting and we care about things, but this is just TOO slow, unpleasantly graphic and frankly not very interesting. At least that's now 28 1/2 episodes I'll not have to sit through.
